page.title: 04CRADLEY HEATH RAILWAY STN.
page.content: CRADLEY HEATH RAILWAY STATION AND BUS STATION WERE OFFICALLY OPENED ON AUGUST 2nd 1983.A MODERN RAILWAY STATION HAS BEEN BUILT ON A NEW SITE. IT CONTAINS A SMALL TICKET OFFICE AND A WAITING ROOM. THE RAILWAY LINE RUNS FROM WORCESTER TO NEW STREET STATION BIRMINGHAM. CRADLEY HEATH HAS AN AVERAGE OF SIX TRAINS STOPPING AT THE STATION EACH HOUR.THE BUSIEST TIME OF THE DAY AT THE STATION IS BETWEEN 06.30 AND 14.00.THE FARE FROM CRADLEY HEATH TO BIRMINGHAM BEFORE 09.30 IS Â£1.70 FOR AN ADULT.A TOTAL OF FOUR EMPLOYEES KEEP THE STATION IN WORKING ORDER, TWO WORKING IN THE SIGNAL BOX,TWO WORKING IN THE TICKET OFFICE.THE BUS STATION ADJACENT TO THE RAILWAY STATION IS A STOPPING POINT FOR THE WEST MIDLANDS BUS SERVICE.A TOTAL OF 16 ROUTES PASS THROUGH THIS TERMINAL.
